body:
If you try to run the e2e Networking tests without a cloud provider (e.g. on bare metal or VM setup),
the pod-Service Networking tests (http and UDP) panic when config.ExternalAddrs[0] is
accessed and the slice is empty.

What should be done in this case is to have a check to see if any ExternalAddrs are provided, and
if not, fallback to using one of the InternalAddrs. This will avoid the panic, and the internal
address chosen might work in some cases.

-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
> /kind bug
/kind feature

/sig network
/area ipv6

**What happened**:
Run e2e Networking tests without a configured provider (e.g. on baremetal or VMs), and the
pod-Service http and udp tests panic when config.ExternalAddrs[0] is accessed and the slice
is empty:
```
Panic [62.544 seconds]
[sig-network] Networking
/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/framework.go:22
  Granular Checks: Services [Slow]
 /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/networking.go:203
    should function for pod-Service: http [It]
    /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/networking.go:110

    Test Panicked
    runtime error: index out of range
    /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:489
```

**What you expected to happen**:
It would be much better in this case, when there are no external addresses provided by a cloud provider, to fallback to try using internal addresses. This avoids the panic, and in some cases, the internal addresses might have the required external connectivity to run the pod-Service tests.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Run the Networking pod-Service tests on a multinode setup without a cloud provider, e.g.:
```
go run hack/e2e.go -- --provider=local -v --test --test_args="--host=https://<api-server-ip-address>:6443 --ginkgo.focus=pod-Service --num-nodes=2"
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Latest master
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: VirtualBox cluster, Ubuntu 16.04.1 host, CentOS 7 guests
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS 7
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 3.10.0-514.26.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 4 15:04:05 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools:
- Others:
